interestAreas.title: Gaming
interestAreas.description: A game is a structured form of play, usually undertaken for entertainment or fun, and sometimes used as an educational tool.

interestAreas.title: E-sport
interestAreas.description: Esports is a form of sport competition using video games.

interestAreas.title: Cosplay
interestAreas.description: Cosplay, a portmanteau of the words costume play, is an activity and performance art in which participants called cosplayers wear costumes and fashion accessories to represent a specific character.

title: Comic Con
description: A convention for comic book fans

interestAreas.title: Comics
interestAreas.description: A comic book, also called comic magazine or simply comic, is a publication that consists of comics art in the form of sequential juxtaposed panels that represent individual scenes.

interestAreas.title: Anime
interestAreas.description: Anime is hand-drawn and computer animation originating from Japan.

interestAreas.title: Manga
interestAreas.description: Manga are comics or graphic novels originating from Japan.

title: Kraftwerk
description: A German electronic music band formed in 1970

interestAreas.title: Electronic music
interestAreas.description: Electronic music is music that employs electronic musical instruments, digital instruments, or circuitry-based music technology in its creation.

interestAreas.title: Synthpop
interestAreas.description: Synth-pop is a subgenre of new wave music that first became prominent in the late 1970s and features the synthesizer as the dominant musical instrument.

interestAreas.title: Krautrock
interestAreas.description: Krautrock is a broad genre of experimental rock that developed in West Germany in the late 1960s and early 1970s among artists who blended psychedelic rock, electronic music, and avant-garde compositional approaches.

title: Summerburst
description: The biggest EDM festival in Sweden

interestAreas.title: Electronic music
interestAreas.description: Electronic music is music that employs electronic musical instruments, digital instruments, or circuitry-based music technology in its creation.

interestAreas.title: EDM
interestAreas.description: Electronic dance music is a broad range of percussive electronic music genres made largely for nightclubs, raves, and festivals.

interestAreas.title: House
interestAreas.description: House is a genre of electronic dance music characterized by a repetitive four on the floor beat and a tempo of 120 to 130 beats per minute.

title: Way out west
description: A three-day music festival held in Gothenburg

interestAreas.title: Rock
interestAreas.description: Rock music is a broad genre of popular music that originated as 'rock and roll' in the United States in the early 1950s, and developed into a range of different styles in the 1960s and later.

interestAreas.title: Pop
interestAreas.description: Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in its modern form during the mid-1950s in the United States and the United Kingdom.

interestAreas.title: Hip hop
interestAreas.description: Hip hop or hip-hop is a culture and art movement that was created by African Americans, Latino Americans and Caribbean Americans in the Bronx, New York City.
